titles.title: Anime de Wakaru Shinryounaika
アニメで分かる心療内科
Comical Psychosomatic Medicine
Anime de Wakaru Shinryônaika
애니메이션으로 배우는 심신의학

anime.description: The manga`s story centers on the psychologist http://anidb.net/ch71227 [Ryou] and his nurse http://anidb.net/ch71223 [Asuna]. The pair explain aspects of mental illness through a series of loosely connected cases that usually conclude in one manga chapter. With a light-hearted tone, the doctor helps readers understand conditions such as depression, adjustment disorder, and Asperger syndrome. Source: ANN

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: nurse
tag.description: For hentai shows, it`s enough if a http://anidb.net/t884 [nurse costume] is worn without the female character actually working as a nurse. For ecchi shows, the nurse profession must play a big enough part in the overall setting. Almost completely exclusive to hentai animations.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: voyeurism
tag.description: Voyeurism is the sexual interest in or practice of spying on people engaged in intimate behaviors, such as undressing, sexual activity, or other actions usually considered to be of a private nature. The principal characteristic of voyeurism is that the voyeur does not normally interact directly with the subject of his/her interest, who is often unaware of being observed. The essence of voyeurism is the observing but may also involve the making of a secret photograph or video of the subject during an intimate activity. When the interest in a particular subject is obsessive, the behavior may be described as stalking. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: exhibitionism
tag.description: Exhibitionism is the act of exposing in a public or semi-public context the parts of one`s body that are not normally exposed. That may be done to prompt sexual arousal, but many forms of exhibitionism actually mean to create humour or disparagement through shock value or mockery. The idea of exhibitionism is closely tied to the notions of decency and modesty in dressing, and as such is highly dependent on one`s own cultural background. Certain forms of exhibitionism may be considered indecent exposure, and thus in many jurisdictions they may lead to civil or criminal charges. While both deal with the lack of clothing and may in certain cases overlap, exhibitionism is very different from and not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t2304 [nudism].

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: pornography
tag.description: Anime clearly marked as "Restricted 18" material centring on all variations of adult sex, some of which can be considered as quite perverted. To certain extent, some of the elements can be seen on late night TV animations.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: cultural references
tag.description: The plot of this anime shows signs of cultural references, these are often jokes that make reference to a certain custom, habit or history that is specifically attributed to that culture. Knowledge of the culture itself is needed in order to properly understand these jokes.

tag.name: healthcare and medicine
tag.description: The anime contains themes related to healthcare, medicine, or the human body.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: live-action imagery
tag.description: This anime incorporates still images and/or video footage of real-world objects and locations into the animation.

tag.name: educational
tag.description: The entire series (at least a major part of it) is centred on a particular subject. Information is fed to the audience in a sublime manner. Most of the time an on-screen written comment by the narrator (or translator) can be seen, e.g. biological specimen, medicine, process, etc. Sometimes at the end of every episode’s closing song, a 20 seconds educational clip is presented.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

episode.title: 睡眠障害を改善するには?
How Do You Remedy a Sleep Disorder?
Qu’est-ce que le trouble du sommeil ?
Suimin Shougai o Kazen Suru ni wa?
episode.summary: This week`s theme is sleep disorders. Does your sleep become more shallow with age? Also, what are "early awakening" and "Awakening Mid-Way"?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 認知症...あなたの知能は大丈夫?
Cognitive Impairment... Is Your Intelligence Okay?
La démence... Comment vont vos capacités intellectuelles ?
Ninchishou... Anata no Chinou wa Daijoubu?
episode.summary: Today`s theme is "cognitive impairment." If young people show symptoms, there may be depression, schizophrenia, or some other condition below the surface...?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ロリコンはどこから病気なの?
At What Point Is a Lolita Complex a Sickness?
D`où vient le trouble du lolicon ?
Lolicon wa Doko kara Byouki na no?
episode.summary: A "lolita complex" is referred to in psychiatry as "pedophilia." All of you with lolita complexes can`t miss this one! Where is the borderline into pedophilia?! ...And so, this week`s theme is the "lolita complex." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: EDを改善する方法は?
How Do You Remedy an ED?
Les troubles de l’érection ?
ED o Kaizensuru Houhou wa?
episode.summary: Mental disorders are conditions affecting the mind, such as depression, anxiety disorder, and panic attacks. The theme of the first episode of Comic Psychosomatic Medicine is "ED." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending
EDの決定的な治療法は?
What`s a Surefire Way to Remedy an ED?
Un traitement définitif contre la dysfonction érectile ?
ED no Ketteiteki na Chiryouhou wa?
episode.summary: Today`s theme is "surefire ED remedies." ED doesn`t necessarily mean you can`t get an erection at all, but is connected to your sexual satisfaction level?! ...Is that a sea cucumber monster? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 「うつ」ってどんな病気なの?
What Kind of Disorder Is Depression?
La dépression, quelle est cette maladie ?
"Utsu"tte Donna Byouki na no?
episode.summary: Today`s theme is "depression." What`s the test that can diagnose depression with 70-90% accuracy? Also, Asuna swears to drop the dirty jokes?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パニック障害って何ですか?
What Is Panic Disorder?
Qu’est-ce que le trouble panique ?
Panic Shougaitte Nandesuka?
episode.summary: This week`s theme is "panic disorder." What is the "agoraphobia" that can develop as a result of recurring panic attacks?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 好きな色でメンタルの全てが分かる!
Your Favorite Color Tells All About Your Mental State!
Comprendre votre personnalité avec votre couleur favorite !
Suki na Iro de Mental no Subete ga Wakaru!
episode.summary: A girl calling herself the goddess of color appears... Just who is she?! And so, today`s theme is "A mental check based on your favorite color." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 露出症の治療法は?
How Do You Remedy Exhibitionism?
Comment traiter l’exhibitionnisme ?
Roshutsushou no Chiryouhou wa?
episode.summary: This week`s theme is "exhibitionism." Most male flashers are meek, quiet men?! And how should you react when flashed? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: フェティシズムの治療法は?
How Do You Remedy Fetishism?
Un traitement au fétichisme ?
Fetishism no Chiryouhou wa?
episode.summary: When people commonly speak of fetishes, they`re referring to what`s known in psychiatry as "fetishism." One example is the underwear fetish. At what point is this considered an illness?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 「のぞき」はどこから病気なの?
At What Point Is Voyeurism a Sickness?
D’où vient le trouble du voyeurisme ?
"Nozoki" wa Doko kara Byouki nano?
episode.summary: This week`s theme is "voyeurism." Peeping behavior is referred to in psychiatry as voyeurism. What mechanisms drive peeping toms to behave this way?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 絶望は4段階で受け入れる!?
Accept Grief in Four Stages?!
Quelles sont les quatre étapes pour accepter son désespoir ?
Zetsubou wa 4 Dankai de Ukeireru!?
episode.summary: This week`s theme is "how to accept grief." Can you overcome grief by accepting it?! And that well-known Warring States general attends a mixer for a change of pace?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 睡眠時無呼吸症候群に気を付けて!
Be Careful of Sleep Apnea Syndrome!
Attention au syndrome d’apnées du sommeil !
Suiminjimukokyuushoukougun ni Ki o Tsukete!
episode.summary: If you`re concerned that your sleep is too shallow, you may have sleep apnea syndrome?! And it could lead to hardening of the arteries, heart failure, or high blood pressure...?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 社会不安障害ってなんですか?
What Is Social Anxiety Disorder?
Qu’est-ce que la phobie sociale ?
Shakaifuanshougaitte Nandesuka?
episode.summary: The emergence of extreme feelings of anxiety is known as "anxiety disorder." What characterizes anxiety disorders such as the fear of public speaking or of being exposed to the eyes of others? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 心の病気になりやすい人の, 無意識のパターン
Subconscious Patterns of People Likely to Suffer from Mental Disorders
Les façons de penser inconscientes des personnes sujettes aux troubles mentaux
Kokoro no Byouki ni Nari Yasui Hito no, Muishiki no Pattern
episode.summary: People who can`t readily accept compliments are not confident in themselves?! This episode will explain the "cognitive consistency theory." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: つらいことを積極的に考えろ!?
Think Proactively About Painful Things?!
Pensons activement aux choses pénibles !
Tsurai Koto o Sekkyokuteki ni Kangaero!?
episode.summary: School and work are breeding grounds for stress. How can we make painful things easier to deal with? Is thinking proactively about them really better than not thinking about them?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ストーカーの心理とは?
What Is the Mentality of Stalkers?
Quel est l’état psychologique d’un rôdeur ?
Stalker no Shinri to wa?
episode.summary: Today`s theme is "stalkers." What stalkers desire is a form of mental nourishment known as "strokes." But what are strokes? The doctor will explain it in simple terms. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 季節性感情障害ってなんですか?
What Is Seasonal Affective Disorder?
Qu’est-ce que le trouble affectif saisonnier ?
Kisetsu Seikan Joushougaitte Nandesuka?
episode.summary: Seasonal affective disorder, also known as seasonal depression, causes depressive symptoms during only certain times of the year... and there`s a pattern to it?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: メンタルクリニックってどういうところ?
What Kind of Place Is a Mental Clinic?
Quel genre d’endroit est une clinique psychiatrique ?
Mental Clinic tte Dou Iu Tokoro?
episode.summary: Today`s theme is "What is a mental clinic like?" We`ll explain in easy-to-understand detail what a mental clinic is actually like! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 心がつらいのは何曜日?
What Day Is the Toughest on Your Mental State?
Quel jour êtes-vous déprimé ?
Kokoro ga Tsurai no wa Nanyoubi?
episode.summary: What is the "dominant response" that comes about when you try to psych yourself up before doing something you don`t want to? Trying too hard to psych yourself up can have the opposite effect?! Source: crunchyroll
